page.title: 03SOUTHILL HOUSE.(ONE)
page.content: Southill House is a{Georgian house}in {Cranmore,}built of{Doulting stone.}It is thought that the house was built for the{Strode}family who then owned most of{Cranmore,}then known as {Strode.}Around 1890 it was sold to the Spencers together with 6 farms and 20,000 acres for Â£30,000. The house has about 50 rooms.Many of the cupboards are as big as a modern bedroom.Under the house flows a stream. There is a large cellar split into small rooms,one of which is used as a wine store.At the foot of the stairs still hangs a portrait of Mrs. {Chetham Strode}the first lady of the house. She had no children and died at only 30.After the death of her husband, Mr{Chetham Strode}the house was handed down to his brother Mr {Chetham,}who then changed his name to {Chetham Strode.
